paper_abstract: We study the numeration system with a negative base, introduced by Ito and Sadahiro. We focus on arithmetic operations in the sets Fin(-beta) and Z(-beta) of numbers having finite resp. integer (-beta)-expansions. We show that Fin(-beta) is trivial if beta is smaller than the golden ratio 1/2(1 + root 5). For beta >= 1/2(1 + root 5) we prove that Fin(-beta) is a ring, only if beta is a Pisot or Salem number with no negative conjugates. We prove the conjecture of Ito and Sadahiro that Fin(-beta) is a ring if beta is a quadratic Pisot number with positive conjugate. For quadratic Pisot units, we determine the number of fractional digits that may appear when adding or multiplying two (-beta)-integers. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Arithmetics in number systems with a negative base
